summary:
I have 10 years of work experience and hold a Master degree in International Development Studies for the UvA. I am pursuing a career in a vibrant and socially responsible work environment. I have extensive experience in working in multicultural agencies, governmental institutions and international organizations and feel my previous employment roles have given me the necessary skills to plan and coordinate projects  related to international cooperation and sustainability, as well as qualitative and quantitative research skills to prepare briefs, reports and monitoring and evaluating projects' performance, both at national or international level.  I also have 10 years of proven experience coordinating international workshops and seminars, as well as ministerial summits in several locations, as well as events logistics (such as flights, accommodations, etc.) both in business and social  events.
I am a motivated and enthusiastic person, who would thrive whilst working in a multicultural and flexible environment. I am a very good negotiator and coordinator and I possess a strong leadership, team building and communication skills. 

I also have experience teaching Spanish  as a second language, doing translations from English to Spanish and vice versa, Spanish proofreading and editing, tutoring, homework help to both adults and children and regularization classes for children and teenagers.

education.degree_name: Master of Science (MSc) International Developmet Studies
Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) B.A. International Relations

profile_positions.description:
-Provide support for Booking.com’s applicant tracking system: GH and with TA tools: MyAlly, HackerRank, Eightfold, Harver, SocialTalent, HireRight and other internal/external tooling that interfaces with recruitment. (How to add a job, why an assessment is not sent, scheduling issues, etc).
-Provide support and guidance regarding process and policies (Compliance, HWH, Internal policy, Referral, etc.)
-Coordinate new projects and follow up in the implementation.
-POC with vendors.
-Ensure candidate data accuracy and inform recruiters of errors.
-Support all recruitment software licenses such as LinkedIn, Entelo, and other third-party sourcing tools.
-Act as recruitment tool SME and response SNow (help desk) tickets; delegate tickets to recruiters as needed.
-Partner with other departments on solving process and/or recruiting system challenges.
-Continuously suggest process improvements and innovation within recruitment.
profile_positions.title: Recruitment Support Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Support all recruitment coordination activities including: scheduling phone and in person interviews, managing interview days, facilitating debriefs, and managing overall “candidate experience”
Create a “white glove” interview experience for senior-level candidates and hiring managers
Book all domestic and international candidate travel, arrange necessary visa letters and manage candidate expenses associated with interviews
Balance multiple candidate schedules on any given day and ensure that interview days run smoothly. Act as POC for all candidates, recruiters and interviewers for interview days
Track and maintain all candidates, candidate communication, interviewer panels, and feedback in the ATS
Continuous improvement of senior recruitment and on-boarding processes to create a seamless and high quality "candidate experience"
Assist in the planning, coordination, set-up and marketing of all networking and recruiting events (including networking events, career fairs, information sessions, diversity events)
profile_positions.title: Recruitment coordinator

profile_positions.description:
First point of contact for Booking.com’s accommodation partners by phone; answering questions and queries, and taking action as needed; Design, development, coordination, reporting and monitoring Program’s activities.
Responsible for delivering a high level of service to Booking.com accommodation partners in order to support building productive and continuing relationships
Advising accommodation partners about their webpages on Booking.com and how they can amend information with respect to supply, availability, specials, promotions
Verifying accuracy of information provided by the partner on the website
Main Achievements:
Improving my PSAT numbers as well as great comments from my Quality Coach and also from my TL.
profile_positions.title: Accommodation Service Executive - Spanish

company.name: IH House México, Colegio Regina, Colegio Claudina Thevenet

profile_positions.company: IH House México, Colegio Regina, Colegio Claudina Thevenet
profile_positions.description:
Teaching Spanish as a second language, translations from English to Spanish and vice versa, Spanish proofreading and editing, tutoring, homework help to both adults and children and regularization classes for children and teenagers.
International organisation coordinating technical cooperation between American and European countries. Delivering executive support, with communication between member countries in English and Spanish. Editing and proofreading coordinator for internal documents and publishing material, translations and quality assurance. Preparation of English brochures. 
Executive support in both English and Spanish. Academic support coordinator for editing and proof reading of internal and external documents, as well as papers and presentations translations from English to Spanish and vice versa, for instance member of the translation team of the “OECD: Rural Policy Review – México” (published book).
profile_positions.title: Freelance Spanish teacher

company.name: Programa Iberoamericano de Gestión Territorial - PROTERRITORIOS

profile_positions.company: Programa Iberoamericano de Gestión Territorial - PROTERRITORIOS
profile_positions.description:
Design, development, coordination, reporting and monitoring Program’s activities.
Data management and analysis for the design and drafting of public political affairs reports regarding sustainability, ecotourism  and climate change.
Global mobility coordination (relocation and mobility)
Responsible of the Program’s relations and networking with partners and vendors.
Management of the Program’s public image through its web page and the social media, moderating online discussions, blogs, G Suit and CIT’s tools to gather insights and performance evaluations. 
Coordination and supervision of international meetings, Ministerial summits and workshops.
Main Achievements:
−	Proposal, design, implementation and consolidation of the Program and mobility area at the Ibero-American level, given its approval by 11 member countries in the Ibero-American Conference of Heads of State and Governments.
−	Analysis and exchange of successful experiences and best practices in rural development policies from 7 countries, which has impacted directly on the Sustainable Rural Development Law in 2 countries and several local development projects in rural areas. 
−	Creation and relocation of a research international network, gathering a team formed by 35 universities and research centres from 11 countries, achieving 5 comparative policy reviews between Mexico, Brazil and Colombia, which included best practices to improve living conditions in rural areas. 
−	Drafting and editing several reports and publications.
−	Organization of 4 Inter-governmental Committees and 7 Executive Councils Meetings in different locations (Brazil, Costa Rica, Colombia and Mexico) with the participation of the Ministers and Vice-ministers undertaking medullar decision-making and approvals.
profile_positions.title: Global Mobility Cooperation and Public Affairs Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Design, development, coordination, reporting and monitoring Program’s researches and evaluations. 
- Data gathering, management and analysis for outcomes design and drafting. Qualitative and quantitative research through  1-on-1 usability testing, surveys, focus groups, and contextual studies. Evaluating results and satisfaction. 
- Responsible of the Program’s relations and networking regarding hypothesis-testing, surveys, focus groups, questionnaires, documents research analysis with governmental representatives, civil society, international organisations, academia, customers and partners. 
- Management of the Program’s public image through its web page and the social media, moderating online discussions, blogs and CIT’s tools to gather insights and performance evaluations. - Coordination and supervision meetings, workshops, focus groups.
Main Achievements: 
- Proposal, design, implementation and consolidation of the Program ́s data report. 
- Drafting and editing several reports and publications (such as “Aportes del IICA a la Gestión del Conocimiento de la Agricultura en México”). 
- Organization of 4 Inter-governmental Committees and 7 Executive Councils Meetings in different locations (Brazil, Costa Rica, Colombia and Mexico) with the participation of the Ministers and Vice-ministers undertaking medullar decision-making and approvals.
profile_positions.title: Project manager for Cooperation

profile_positions.description:
-Meeting with clients to understand the purpose of the event and needs.
-Follow customer's instructions and adding ideas to fulfill their needs.
-Monitoring events activities to make sure the customer and attenders satisfaction.
Main achievements:
-More than 30 social and corporate events planned and executed with over than 850 participants.
profile_positions.title: Freelance social and corporate events

profile_positions.location: Ciudad de México y alrededores, México
profile_positions.description:
−	Review and analysis of donation projects submitted by Foundations, Health Ministries and National Institutes, in order to optimize the donations and support more projects.
−	Supervision of applicant institutions in order to evaluate their performance, operation and capacity to manage the donation.
Main Achievements:
−	The number of projects supported by donations increased 27% in 2009 compared to the previous year.
profile_positions.title: Health Department Director´s Assistant

profile_positions.location: Ciudad de México y alrededores, México
profile_positions.description:
−	Elaboration of the thematic content, official documents, political affairs reports and drafts regarding rural development, especially in relation to the Ley de Desarrollo Rural Sustentable.
−	Be the institutional contact with our allies and our governmental and non-governmental partners such as GIZ, IICA, FIDA, USAID, FAO, Rural Development Congress Commission, in topics related to rural development, capability building, best practices exchange and political affairs. 
−	Event planning and logistics regarding international attendees’ and panellists’ schedules, transportation, accommodation, budget, and funds management.
Main Achievements:
−	Participation in the working group for data gathering to prepare the "OCDE Rural Policy Review: Mexico 2006". 
−	Consolidation of the Inter-agency Group formed by FAO, WB, IADB, GIZ, USAID, CEPAL, IICA and SAGARPA, aimed at technical cooperation between members. 
Coordination of the International Seminar “Desarrollo Rural y el Sector Agroalimentario: Estrategias de Futuro” with 800 attendees, 12 international speakers, 6 noted national journalists; this event was mentioned by the Minister given its achievements and impact.
profile_positions.title: International Projects Deputy Director
